inclusion.criterion: Diffuse large B-cell lymphoma (LDCGB) histological diagnosis according to the WHO classification.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Refractory lymphoma or relapsed after 1st line treatment consisting of rituximab combined with a regimen of chemotherapy including anthracyclines.
inclusion.label: not_met

inclusion.criterion: Eastern cooperative oncology group performance status (ECOG) less than or equal to 2.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Resolution of toxicities caused by the 1st line regimen to less than or equal to grade 2.
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Women of childbearing age must obtain a negative pregnancy test before starting medically supervised therapy study.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: 12 male patients must accept to use a latex condom during any sexual relations with women of childbearing potential.
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: All patients must understand that the study drug could potentially have a teratogenic risk.
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: Patients that previously received any antitumor agent for the treatment of LDCGB except rituximab in combination with regimen including anthracyclines or radiotherapy as part of first-line treatment.
exclusion.label: triggers

exclusion.criterion: Known involvement of the central nervous system (CNS) by lymphoma.
exclusion.label: triggers

notes: Patient has a history of viral encephalitis/meningitis with ICH and seizure/stroke, which may compromise their ability to comply with treatment. Additionally, they have a large pericardial effusion due to Burkitt's lymphoma, which requires further evaluation.
